metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8954 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MemcmpLowercase function in Suricata before 2.0.6 improperly excludes the first byte from comparisons, which might allow remote attackers to bypass intrusion-prevention functionality via a crafted HTTP request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8954` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

suricata - 3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: suricata package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0-1').
